title: The OCF Type manifest schema
description: Primitive, that holds the JSONSchema which describes that Type. It’s also used for validation. There are core and custom Types. Type can be also a composition of other Types.

value.title: The value schema
value.description: Holds the configuration constraints for the given entry. It needs to be valid against the Type JSONSchema.

name.title: The name schema
name.description: The name of the Type. Root prefix can be skipped if it’s a core Type. If it is a custom Type then it MUST be defined as full path to that Type. Custom Type MUST extend the abstract node which is defined as a root prefix for that entry.

revision.title: The revision schema
revision.description: The revision version of the given Type.

tags.title: The tags schema
tags.description: The tags is a list of key value, OCF Tags. Describes the OCF Implementation (provides generic categorization) and are used to filter out a specific Implementation.

license.description: This entry allows you to specify a license, so people know how they are permitted to use it, and what kind of restrictions you are placing on it.

name.description: If you are using a common license such as BSD-2-Clause or MIT, add a current SPDX license identifier for the license you’re using e.g. BSD-3-Clause. If your package is licensed under multiple common licenses, use an SPDX license expression syntax version 2.0 string, e.g. (ISC OR GPL-3.0)

ref.description: If you are using a license that hasn’t been assigned an SPDX identifier, or if you are using a custom license, use the direct link to the license file e.g. https://raw.githubusercontent.com/project/v1/license.md. The resource under given link MUST be immutable and publicly accessible.

spec.title: The spec schema
spec.description: A container for the Implementation specification definition.

appVersion.title: The appVersion schema
appVersion.description: The supported application versions in SemVer2 format.

implements.title: The implements schema
implements.description: Defines what kind of interfaces this implementation fulfills.

name.title: The name schema
name.description: The Interface name, for example cap.interfaces.db.mysql.install

requires.title: The requires schema
requires.description: List of the system prerequisites that need to be present on the cluster. There has to be an Instance for every concrete type.

^[a-zA-Z.]+$.title: The prefix schema
^[a-zA-Z.]+$.description: Prefix MUST be an abstract node and represents a core abstract Type e.g. cap.core.type.platform. Custom Types are not allowed.

oneOf.title: The oneOf schema
oneOf.description: Exactly one of the given types MUST have an Instance on the cluster. Element on the list MUST resolves to concrete Type.

allOf.title: The allOf schema
allOf.description: All of the given types MUST have an Instance on the cluster. Element on the list MUST resolves to concrete Type.

anyOf.title: The anyOf schema
anyOf.description: Any (one or more) of the given types MUST have an Instance on the cluster. Element on the list MUST resolves to concrete Type.

imports.title: The imports schema
imports.description: List of external Interfaces that this Implementation requires to be able to execute the action.

name.title: The name schema
name.description: The name of the group that holds specific actions that you want to import, for example cap.interfaces.db.mysql

alias.title: The alias schema
alias.description: The alias for the full name of the imported group name. It can be used later in the workflow definition instead of using full name.

appVersion.title: The appVersion schema
appVersion.description: The supported application versions in SemVer2 format.

methods.title: The methods schema
methods.description: The list of all required actions’ names that must be imported.

action.title: The action schema
action.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

args.title: The args schema
args.description: Holds all parameters that should be passed to the selected runner, for example repoUrl, or chartName for the Helm3 runner.

type.title: The type schema
type.description: The Interface or Implementation of a runner, which handles the execution, for example, cap.interface.runner.helm3.run
